content: @Amanieu , I'm curious whether I should tweak the wording at https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/reference/inline-assembly.html#rules-for-inline-assembly in light of naked functions, since they deliberately don't specify any registers. Alternatively on the page about naked functions (which I'm writing right now) we could just say that naked functions are an exception to these rules, and that it isn't UB to refer to unspecified registers in that context. Thoughts?
I would prefer keeping that on a page specifically about naked functions. The current list of rules is already very long.
Basically none of the rules apply to naked function since they are closer to global_asm!.
